summary: A "polling station" is a designated location where voters cast their ballots during elections, integral to the electoral procedure and voting framework within the European Union. It serves as a critical component of democratic participation, ensuring the accessibility and integrity of the voting process. Polling stations are established in accordance with EU regulations, which mandate that member states provide adequate facilities to facilitate free and fair elections. The management of polling stations is governed by national laws, aligned with EU directives, to uphold electoral standards and protect voter rights, thereby reinforcing the democratic principles enshrined in EU treaties.
